tweet: News orgs need to have defined, effective policies for correcting tweets. Replying w clarification to the incorrect tweet isn't enough.
Most obviously, it ignores how twitter works. The wrong tweet will circulate more (and independently from) the correction.
Twitter isn't Wordpress. You can't just offer clarifications and trust people see them with the original post.
Deleting, acknowledging the deletion & writing a new, correct tweet is-I think-the right thing to do. Otherwise, bad info is still out there
Journalists tweet twitter like something other than journalism. It's the same. You are giving the public information they should trust.
@JessicaHuseman Shouldn't that apply to @POTUS  @VP @PRyan and @SenateMajLdr too? I've seen more falsehoods from @realDonaldTrump alone than I can count.
@TommyLoon @POTUS @VP @PRyan @SenateMajLdr @realDonaldTrump Yes.

@JessicaHuseman Oh, Jessica, no. 😂
@itsmeroz 😂😂😂

Kobach and Pence have arrived at the first meeting of the voter fraud commission. https://t.co/6LwxRUVAQO
"President Trump knows that the principle of one person one vote is foundational to American democracy," says Pence.
Pence says commission has no preconceived notions and that they are "fact finders."
Pence says he's "grateful" for the "more than 30 states" that have agreed to provide publicly available data.
Trump has arrived. "Every time voter fraud occurs it cancels out the vote" of a legal vote, he says. https://t.co/LCRuaIlW7i
Trump says that if states do not want to share data, we have to ask "what they are worried about."
"If you want to make American great again you have to protect the integrity of the vote and our voters," says Trump.

hey, question: have you ever run into a situation where a home you were moving to was not set up for USPS service yet?

@ACShilton Yes. My apartment didn't have mail service for the first month i lived there bc USPS didn't install the master key until then. The land that i bought wasn't even assigned a 911 address, so I had to do that and then have the county coordinate with USPS.
@JessicaHuseman okay!! do you remember what the process was called with your land? I'm searching the USPS site and not coming back with the right thing!
@ACShilton I mostly didn't have to coordinate with USPS at all. I called the county to have a 911 address assigned, and then they sent that data to USPS and USPS did the rest.

@DGoforth918 @samanthavicent @JessicaHuseman Your earlier tweet was pretty vague on the SS Leader's editorial. We keep getting feedback on something we didn't right. You should clarify your earlier tweet.

@RMhigh7088 @samanthavicent @JessicaHuseman No thanks. All I did was post a Sand Springs editorial and say it was bad. Never implied it had anything to do with the TW. If you’re getting negative feedback stop publishing stuff you didn’t write under your url.
@DGoforth918 @samanthavicent @JessicaHuseman It’s pretty vague. And it’s led to a misunderstanding that’s spreading.

@RMhigh7088 @DGoforth918 @samanthavicent I'm so confused as to how publishing this article by a person who works for your company is "something you did right." A competing editorial by the Tulsa world does not mitigate the choice to publish a factually inaccurate article on the same topic.

@RMhigh7088 @DGoforth918 @samanthavicent That this person is the managing editor not of the tulsa world but of an affiliated paper does not in anyway absolve the Tulsa World of alienating an entire segment of Tulsa's population by showing how out of touch one if its high level employees is.

@JessicaHuseman @RMhigh7088 @samanthavicent I don’t think the TW management has any control over the Sand Sprogns content, though I’d argue they should given that people are posting racist content under their url unchecked apparently?

@DGoforth918 @JessicaHuseman @samanthavicent The Sand Springs Leader has editorial independence, even though they're a BH property. @DGoforth918 @JessicaHuseman @samanthavicent So all I'd ask is a follow-up clarifying that.

@RMhigh7088 @JessicaHuseman @samanthavicent I never said he was a TW employee or that it had anything to do with the TW. I posted the only link where it was hosted.
